Package com.refinedmods.refinedstorage.api.autocrafting

Interface ICraftingPatternContainer

All Known Implementing Classes:
CrafterNetworkNode
public interface ICraftingPatternContainer
Represents a network node that contains crafting patterns.

  • Method Details

    • getUpdateInterval

      default int getUpdateInterval()
      Returns the interval of when a crafting step with a pattern in this container can update. Minimum value is 0 (each tick).

      Note: rather than maxing out the update interval, implementors might want to balance around getMaximumSuccessfulCraftingUpdates(). This method merely speeds up the update rate, it might be more interesting to increase the output rate in getMaximumSuccessfulCraftingUpdates().

      Returns:
      the update interval

    • getMaximumSuccessfulCraftingUpdates

      default int getMaximumSuccessfulCraftingUpdates()
      Returns the amount of successful crafting updates that this container can have per crafting step update. If this limit is reached, crafting patterns from this container won't be able to update until the next eligible crafting step update interval from getUpdateInterval().
      Returns:
      the maximum amount of successful crafting updates

    • getConnectedInventory

      @Nullable net.neoforged.neoforge.items.IItemHandler getConnectedInventory()
      Returns:
      the inventory that this container is connected to, or null if no inventory is present

    • getConnectedFluidInventory

      @Nullable net.neoforged.neoforge.fluids.capability.IFluidHandler getConnectedFluidInventory()
      Returns:
      the fluid inventory that this container is connected to, or null if no fluid inventory is present

    • getConnectedBlockEntity

      @Nullable net.minecraft.world.level.block.entity.BlockEntity getConnectedBlockEntity()
      Returns:
      the block entity that this container is connected to, or null if no block entity is present

    • getFacingBlockEntity

      net.minecraft.world.level.block.entity.BlockEntity getFacingBlockEntity()
      Returns:
      the block entity that this container is facing

    • getDirection

      net.minecraft.core.Direction getDirection()
      Returns:
      the direction to the facing block entity

    • getPatterns

      List<ICraftingPattern> getPatterns()
      Returns:
      the patterns stored in this container

    • getPatternInventory

      @Nullable net.neoforged.neoforge.items.IItemHandlerModifiable getPatternInventory()
      Returns:
      the pattern inventory, or null if no pattern inventory is present

    • getName

      net.minecraft.network.chat.Component getName()
      The name of this container for categorizing in the Crafting Manager GUI. Will return the name of the root container if we're in a chained scenario.
      Returns:
      the name of this container

    • getCustomName

      @Nullable default net.minecraft.network.chat.Component getCustomName()
      The custom name of this container, as set in an anvil for example. Can be null.
      Returns:
      the name of this container

    • getPosition

      net.minecraft.core.BlockPos getPosition()
      Returns:
      the position of this container

    • getRootContainer

      @Nullable ICraftingPatternContainer getRootContainer()
      Containers may be daisy-chained together. If this container points to another one, gets the root container in the chain. If containers are not daisy-chained, returns this container. If there was a container loop, returns null.
      Returns:
      the root pattern container

    • getUuid

      UUID getUuid()
      Returns:
      the UUID of this container

    • isLocked

      default boolean isLocked()
      Returns:
      true if the connected inventory is locked for processing patterns, false otherwise

    • unlock

      void unlock()
      Unlock the container so it may be used by processing pattern

    • onUsedForProcessing

      default void onUsedForProcessing()
      Called when this container is used by a processing pattern to insert items or fluids in the connected inventory.

    • hasConnectedInventory

      default boolean hasConnectedInventory()
      Returns:
      whether the container is successfully connected to the inventory it wants to insert to

    • hasConnectedFluidInventory

      default boolean hasConnectedFluidInventory()
      Returns:
      whether the container is successfully connected to the fluid inventory it wants to insert to

    • insertItemsIntoInventory

      default boolean insertItemsIntoInventory(Collection<net.minecraft.world.item.ItemStack> toInsert, Action action)
      Called by Autocrafting when it uses this crafter in a processing recipe that has items as input
      Parameters:
      toInsert - Collection of Itemstack stacklist entries to insert into the inventory
      action - action to perform
      Returns:
      whether insertion was successful

    • insertFluidsIntoInventory

      default boolean insertFluidsIntoInventory(Collection<net.neoforged.neoforge.fluids.FluidStack> toInsert, Action action)
      Called by Autocrafting when it uses this crafter in a processing recipe that has fluids as input
      Parameters:
      toInsert - Collection of Fluidstack stacklist entries to insert into the inventory
      action - action to perform
      Returns:
      whether insertion was successful
